Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partly grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.220)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36514) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36514)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 385 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
